etymologies: early 17th century: from Portuguese garoupa, probably from a local term in South America

definitions: a large or very large heavy-bodied fish of the sea bass family, with a big head and wide mouth, found in warm seas.

notes.text: Family Serranidae: several genera, in particular Epinephelus and Mycteroperca. The Nassau grouper (E. striatus) is the most economically important fish of the Bahamas

shortDefinitions: large or very large heavy-bodied fish of sea bass family
